definitions.definition: Though , even though , in spite of or despite the fact that: introducing a clause that expresses a concession.
examples: Although it was very muddy, the football game went on.
The patients, (al)though getting stronger, will not come off their medications.
Although proven, the accusation was ignored by the court.
It was difficult, although not as difficult as we had expected.

main_definition: Though , even though , in spite of or despite the fact that: introducing a clause that expresses a concession.
